investors.name: Andreessen Horowitz (a16z)
investors.description: A Silicon Valley powerhouse known for its 'full-stack' support model, offering not just capital but also operational and talent-related services to its portfolio companies. They are famous for their bold investments and for betting on long-term, disruptive technological trends.

investors.name: Sequoia Capital
investors.description: One of the most legendary VC firms in the world, with a long history of backing some of the most successful tech companies. They are known for their focus on 'company building' and for their extensive global network.

investors.name: Lightspeed Venture Partners
investors.description: A multi-stage VC firm with a global presence, including a strong footprint in India. They focus on investing in disruptive innovations in enterprise and consumer markets.

investors.name: Kleiner Perkins
investors.description: A legendary Silicon Valley firm with a history of backing iconic tech companies from the earliest stages. They have a reputation for identifying and supporting exceptional founders.

investors.name: New Enterprise Associates (NEA)
investors.description: One of the world's largest and most active VC firms, with a focus on both technology and healthcare. They are known for their long-term perspective and commitment to building durable companies.
investors.investmentStructure: All stages, from seed to growth equity.

investors.name: Accel
investors.description: A global VC firm that invests across all stages. They have a particularly strong track record in early-stage investments and are known for their deep expertise in various sectors.

investors.name: General Catalyst
investors.description: A VC firm that invests in a wide range of companies, from early-stage startups to established businesses. They are known for their active role in helping founders build great companies.

investors.name: Insight Partners
investors.description: A leading global private equity and venture capital firm specializing in high-growth technology and software companies. They are known for their focus on 'scale-up' investing.

investors.name: SoftBank Vision Fund
investors.description: A massive investment fund managed by SoftBank Group. They are famous for their large, late-stage investments and their focus on companies that are poised to become global leaders.

investors.name: Tiger Global Management
investors.description: A global investment firm that operates both a hedge fund and a private equity/venture capital business. They are known for their fast-paced, high-volume investing, particularly in later-stage rounds.

investors.name: AngelList
investors.description: A platform that has revolutionized early-stage investing by allowing founders to raise capital from a massive network of individual angels and venture funds. It's a go-to for many founders seeking to secure their first round of funding.

investors.name: Y Combinator
investors.description: A world-renowned startup accelerator that has funded thousands of companies. While primarily an accelerator, their alumni network of founders and partners are among the most active angel investors globally.

investors.name: 500 Global
investors.description: A global VC firm with a focus on early-stage investments. They have a strong accelerator program and a vast network of mentors and investors worldwide.

investors.name: Founders Fund
investors.description: A San Francisco-based VC firm that invests in a wide range of companies, from early-stage to growth. The firm is co-founded by Peter Thiel and is known for its contrarian approach to investing.

investors.name: Naval Ravikant
investors.description: Co-founder of AngelList and an incredibly influential figure in the tech and startup world. He is a prolific angel investor and a thought leader on technology, entrepreneurship, and investing.
investors.website: Primarily through platforms like AngelList and professional networks.

investors.name: Jason Calacanis
investors.description: A serial entrepreneur and one of the most well-known angel investors in Silicon Valley. He founded The LAUNCH Festival and is a judge on the podcast The Angel. He is known for his hands-on approach and for investing in early-stage startups.
investors.website: Via his podcast or professional networks.

investors.name: Mark Cuban
investors.description: A billionaire entrepreneur and television personality on the show 'Shark Tank.' He is a highly active angel investor, often investing in a wide variety of companies and products.
industries: All sectors, from consumer products to technology
investors.website: Through his website or the 'Shark Tank' application process.

investors.name: Paul Graham
investors.description: Co-founder of Y Combinator, he is one of the most influential figures in the seed-stage investing world. While he no longer runs Y Combinator, his investment philosophy and essays continue to guide thousands of founders.

investors.name: Reid Hoffman
investors.description: A co-founder of LinkedIn and a partner at the VC firm Greylock. He is a highly respected angel investor with a focus on network effects and companies that have the potential to grow quickly.
investors.website: Through his work at Greylock or professional networks.

investors.name: Peter Thiel
investors.description: A co-founder of PayPal and Palantir, and a partner at Founders Fund. He is a highly influential and often controversial figure known for his contrarian bets and for his early investment in Facebook.
investors.website: Through his work at Founders Fund.
